name: Raata Wind Chimes
description: The oldest of Caldari ways continue to thrive on Caldari Prime, even after the secession of the State. Traditional peoples continue to live in the valleys and forests of the Kaalakiota Peaks. They hold no allegiance to the State, and identify themselves with the ancient Raata culture and customs. The Raata Caldari use these chimes to hear the "voice" of the the venerated winds as they pass through them.
